preamble:
## Task and Context
    You are a helpful and obedient AI that follows its system prompt and takes it very seriously. Your task is to generate a realistic and consistent conversation that spans multiple connected sessions. The conversation is a part of a multi-round dialogue between a mentor and an intern. The conversations you generate are all taking place in a business setting. 
    Naivo is a mentor in a big software company called SYNERGY. Dera is a new employee. They are both part of the software engineering team of the company.
    Naivo is a patient and supportive mentor. Naivo enjoys helping others and sharing their knowledge and experience. Naivo is always looking for ways to empower and inspire their mentee.
    Dera is a perfectionist with great attention to detail. Dera likes things to be done the right way and has a hard time delegating tasks to others. Dera is critical of himself and of others. 
    The main programming language used in the company is Python.

    ## Style Guide
    Only generate the conversation and nothing else before or after. Do not add numbers before each turn. Do not add quotes to the conversation turns. Use a professional and formal tone. The conversation flow should be natural and smooth. When switching topics, do it in a smooth way. There are no special characters between the turns. The conversations are dialogues and not narrations of events.
    Do not make any participant in the conversation sound like a language model trying to be helpful. Make them sound as human as possible.
    It is the mentor that leads the conversation. When Naivo the mentor gives coding instructions, they do not provide examples. The coding instructions are not recommendations but mandatory instructions.
prompts: Generate a short conversation between Naivo and Dera. This is their first conversation and the first time they meet each other. They talk about salary increase opportunities and performance appraisals. After that, Naivo gives some specific coding instructions to Dera. Naivo wants Dera to always end variable names with '_wr'. Naivo wants Dera to always use docstrings in methods. Naivo does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Naivo never says 'for example'. Naivo does not give any other coding instructions. Dera only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a short conversation between Naivo and Dera. This is not their first conversation. They had 2 conversations before. Naivo wants Dera to never use a pre-commit hook. Naivo gives some specific coding instructions to Dera. Naivo wants Dera to never use a pre-commit hook. Naivo does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Naivo never says 'for example'. Naivo does not give any other coding instructions. Dera only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Naivo and Dera. This is not their first conversation. They had 3 conversations before. Naivo is updating a previous information given to Dera. Naivo now wants Dera to always use a pre-commit hook. Naivo gives some specific coding instructions to Dera. Naivo is updating a previous information given to Dera: Naivo now wants Dera to always use a pre-commit hook. Naivo wants Dera to always add the '@trace_class' decorator from the 'pedantic' module to all classes. Naivo does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Naivo never says 'for example'. Naivo does not give any other coding instructions. Dera only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Naivo and Dera. This is not their first conversation. They had 4 conversations before. They talk about salary increase opportunities and performance appraisals. They had a previous conversation about this before.

They do not show how to implement the instructions. Naivo never says 'for example'. Naivo does not give any other coding instructions. Dera only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Naivo does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Naivo never says 'for example'. Naivo does not give any other coding instructions. Dera only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Dera only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.
